page.title: 17ICKFORD 1881
page.content: Some of the children at Ickford school have been looking at the 1881 census for Ickford village.There were 370 people living in Ickford in 1881.There were two blacksmiths in the village and there were two pubs in 1881 and they are still here today. The lord of the manor was Mr Stephens.William Garner was a boot and shoe maker.Christopher Grant was the owner of the Rising Sun.Thats one of the pubs.Edward Kimbell was a local baker in the village.Thomas Brazell owned one of the blacksmiths.John Garner was the rate and tax collector. James Pullen was the other blacksmith.Ann Walker was the day school teacher.John Walker was a cattle dealer.Samuel Woods was another shoe maker.Edward Slade was a carpenter and joiner.
